definition: to cut out (as a dress)/to cut/to trim/to reduce/to diminish/to cut back (e.g. on staff)/decision/judgment
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose

sentences.english: Iwive decided not to sell the house.
Hewis made up his mind to quit his job.
sentences.chinese: 他已裁夺辞去他的工作。

sentences.english: He decided to rent the house.
But he has left the details to Congress.
sentences.chinese: 但至于管制的细节，他任凭美国国会裁夺。

definition: not daring to act for oneself (idiom)
to allow (sb to do as he pleases)
this is no small thing (idiom)/to have a serious matter at hand
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
to act arbitrarily/to make decisions without consulting others
to issue a directive/to instruct (that sth be done)
